msgSnippet: Hello Angela, You re running the test from Eclipse using an Ant command? Can you run it directly in Eclipse (Run as - JUnit test)? It sounds like a conflict

Subject: Re: [junit] ClassDefNotFound Errors
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=49336120

Hello Angela,

You're running the test from Eclipse using an Ant command? Can you run 
it directly in Eclipse (Run as -> JUnit test)? It sounds like a conflict 
in jar versions between Eclipse and Ant. Have you searched the mailing 
list archives (also the Eclipse mailing list archives)? I seem to recall 
this having popped up frequently in the past.

Sorry I can't help more,

John

Angela Day wrote:
> 
> 
> Guys, Help!
> 
> Compiling and running this app is not a problem.  The app has been in 
> production for quite some time.   
> 
> I am getting the following error when I try to run a junit test from 
> within eclipse.  They simply fail from the ant test command.  The 
> tests all get errors if a torque base class is trying to instantiate 
> a skeleton torque class.  I.e, BaseProjectProgram trying to 
> instantiate ProjectProgram.
> 
> java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: 
> org/apache/commons/configuration/ConfigurationException
> 	at org.apache.torque.Torque.getInstance(Torque.java:108)
> 	at org.apache.torque.Torque.isInit(Torque.java:146)
> 	at tdhca.om.base.BaseProjectProgramPeer.<clinit>
> (BaseProjectProgramPeer.java:224)
> 	at tdhca.om.base.BaseProjectProgram.<clinit>
> (BaseProjectProgram.java:45)
> 	at tdhca.om.test.SpecialNeedsTest.setUp
> (SpecialNeedsTest.java:45)
> 	at junit.framework.TestCase.runBare(TestCase.java:138)
> 	at junit.framework.TestResult$1.protect(TestResult.java:106)
> 	at junit.framework.TestResult.runProtected
> (TestResult.java:124)
> 	at junit.framework.TestResult.run(TestResult.java:109)
> 	at junit.framework.TestCase.run(TestCase.java:131)
> 	at junit.framework.TestSuite.runTest(TestSuite.java:173)
> 	at junit.framework.TestSuite.run(TestSuite.java:168)
> 	at 
> org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.runTests
> (RemoteTestRunner.java:395)
> 	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.run
> (RemoteTestRunner.java:279)
> 	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.main
> (RemoteTestRunner.java:171)
> 
> I am at wits end.  Thank you for your consideration.
> 
> Angela
>
